Our Story

About Divine Kitchen

Two decades of passion, flavor, and community in the heart of New York City.

Chef Leo Will

Founder & Executive Chef

Meet the Founder

Leo Will

Born and raised in Brooklyn, Leo Will grew up watching his grandmother transform simple ingredients into extraordinary meals. That childhood wonder never left him — it just grew into an obsession.

After training at the Culinary Institute of America and apprenticing under some of New York's most celebrated chefs, Leo opened Divine Kitchen in 2004 on West 49th Street with a bold vision: create a place where a perfectly seared steak, a delicate piece of sashimi, and a hand-crafted burger could all live under the same roof — each executed with the same obsessive attention to quality.

"I never wanted to be boxed into one cuisine," Leo says. "Great food is great food, whether it's a dry-aged ribeye or a Dragon Roll. The common thread is respect — for the ingredients, for the craft, and for the people you're feeding."

Today, Divine Kitchen serves hundreds of guests weekly, hosts live music every Friday and Sunday, and remains one of Midtown's most beloved dining destinations. Leo still walks the floor most evenings, greeting regulars by name and checking every plate that leaves the pass.

What Drives Us

Our Values

Quality Without Compromise

We source the finest prime steaks, freshest fish flown in daily, and produce from local farms. No shortcuts, ever.

Community First

Divine Kitchen is more than a restaurant — it's a gathering place. We feed our neighborhood, support local artists, and give back whenever we can.

Joy in Every Detail

From the live music on Fridays to the handwritten specials board, every detail is designed to make you smile.

Our Journey

20 Years of Flavor

2004

The Beginning

Leo Will opens the first Divine Kitchen on West 49th Street with just 30 seats and a dream.

2008

Sushi Bar Added

A dedicated sushi counter brings fresh Japanese craft to the menu, earning a devoted following.

2012

Live Music Launches

Friday Night Jazz begins, transforming the dining room into a destination for food and music lovers alike.

2016

Full Renovation

A stunning redesign doubles capacity and introduces the signature open-kitchen concept.

2020

Community First

During challenging times, Divine Kitchen feeds 5,000+ frontline workers across New York City.

2024

20 Years Strong

Two decades of sizzling steaks, fresh sushi, and unforgettable memories — and still going.

Step Inside

Our Space

Divine Kitchen

A New York culinary destination since 2004. Premium steaks, fresh sushi, gourmet burgers, and craft beverages — all under one roof.
